H0.text: The formation of bubbles indicates that a chemical reaction occurred when students combined baking soda and vinegar to demonstrate the reaction.

H1.text: A reduction in total mass indicates that a chemical reaction occurred when students combined baking soda and vinegar.

H2.text: The disappearance of atoms indicates that a chemical reaction occurred when students combined baking soda and vinegar to demonstrate it.

H3.text: An increase in the number of atoms indicates that a chemical reaction occurred when students combined baking soda and vinegar to demonstrate a chemical reaction.

A4.text: The bubbles are created because, when the baking powder is combined with water, the sodium bicarbonate and acid salts react to produce gaseous carbon dioxide.
